Change has been successfully merged
Overall, this looks good. I just have some nitpick concerns about error handling and edge cases.
The CI (Jenkins) is not running because the owner of this change is not in the allowlist. I am not sure how to do this, it's not something I have access to. Please ask on the Discord.

It might be possible to re-use an existing function here:

https://github.com/openbmc/phosphor-pid-control/blob/8c051121ade815a46e39d5c669fee77302df2b6d/dbus/dbusconfiguration.cpp#L77

I would prefer to have only one D-Bus escaping function in the program, since only one should be needed. We should probably clean up `sensorNameToDbusName()` and use that, instead of adding another function to serve the same purpose.
will study it

hello Josh:
are you saying we got to make sensorNameToDbusName() avaliable for other functions to use ? because the sensorNameToDbusName() is declared as a incline function so it can only be used in dbusconfiguration.cpp

hello Josh:
quick update here , we found the way to convert pidname to match dbusname rule 
without modifying sensorNameToDbusName() declaration
we do the conversion somewhere else , will update the patch later on
OK, let me know where the conversion takes place at. The `pidname` still needs to be validated as a D-Bus object name before being used directly, otherwise it will crash when used.
Mark Resolved
Thanks! Good analysis, I had missed seeing that fix earlier.

What happens if `pidname` is an empty string? This can happen, because PID loops do not necessarily have to have names (see my later comment). It is an error for an D-Bus object path component to be empty. If an empty string is passed in, we should fall back to `"_"`.

we dont need to worry about pidname is an empty string case

case1 : dbus-configuration method (entity manager)
this empty string will cause entity manager fail to run , so the user will fix this mis-configuration naturally

case2: config.json (static way)
pid service will fail during building json stage

 generally speaking, the empty pidname string will not be able passed on to 
 buildzone stage
Understood, good analysis.

Please also clear the _maximumSetPointName string here, so that it will properly show up as an empty string, instead of incorrectly holding over the previous contents. Because of the disable feature, we are going to see the case of an empty _SetPoints vector much more often in practice now. So, it is important that we have correct default behavior in this situation.

hello josh:
I was thinking of reset _maximumSetPointName here before , at that time
because it follow the same logic as reset _maximumSetPoint
however 
just found  _maximumSetPointName will be cleared out in if (minThermalThreshold >= _maximumSetPoint) condition , 

we will reset the string here because you suggested to change to Minimum
in #272
That is correct. Thanks.

This will also happen much more frequently now, with the disable feature we are adding. I request this string be changed from `""` to `"Minimum"`, to more correctly identify the source of the setpoint when this happens. This will also align with the behavior of `"Ceiling"` above.
get you point
Thanks

What happens if `name` already exists in the map? We should print a warning message when this happens. This will help users detect this configuration mistake.

Also, we should also print a warning message if `name` is an empty string. I think, but I am not sure, that `name` is optional using the old hardcoded JSON file syntax (not the modern `entity-manager` syntax). So, it could theoretically be empty, in an old configuration, and we should not consider this to be an error.

are you talking about the same name of two pidloops?
we will check empty name string case two
Thanks for adding the warning message in `buildjson.cpp` earlier. That should be sufficient.
The log from Jenkins has a segfault when running the unit test. Can you try running the unit tests manually with gdb and seeing where it crashes?
Please word wrap the commit message at 72 characters (except for unavoidable long lines like URL or command output).
OK, I will modify the commit message.
Mark Resolved
This looks good now, just comments about string types and D-Bus name validation
#J
Ack
Once the function is changed to use C++ strings throughout, then `.c_str()` will no longer be necessary.
OK, I will remove it.
Mark Resolved
Same regarding `.c_str()`
Mark Resolved
Thanks for adding this warning message.
Mixing C and C++ strings in the same function is awkward. Please standardize on `std::string` syntax.
OK, I will use C++ consistently.
Mark Resolved
Nice work
It's been about a week, no objections received, giving +2
Using `clear()` is preferred, but this is also acceptable.
I think 'clear' is better, and I have made the modifications.

hello Josh:

after this is done
how we are going to submit code?
or someone will do the merge ?
It's "Ready To Submit" now, so you can go ahead and hit the big purple button at top. That should take care of merging it in.
Thanks for making the change, giving +2 again as it got stripped by Gerrit
